data.title: Martin Pender Obituary
data.meta_description: SHIRLEY - Martin J. Pender, 87, formerly of Clark Road and Ayer, died Friday morning at the Apple Valley Nursing & Rehabilitation Center, Ayer.Mr. Pende
data.text: SHIRLEY – Martin J. Pender, 87, formerly of Clark Road and Ayer, died Friday morning at the Apple Valley Nursing & Rehabilitation Center, Ayer.Mr. Pender was born in Ayer on Oct. 4, 1916, a son of Daniel P. and Mary T. (Rouine) Pender, and resided most of his life in the Ayer and Shirley areas.For more than 30 years, Mr. Pender worked as a supply foreman at the Former Fort Devens, retiring in 1968.During WWII, Mr. Pender served his country in the U.S. Army. He attended St. Mary’s Church in Ayer and St. Anthony of Padua Church. He was a former member of the Knights of Columbus, Ayer Council.He was the husband of Doris K. (McCaffrey) Pender, who died in 1997.He is survived by two sons and daughters-in-law, Drs. Daniel J. and Vivian Pender of New York City, and M. Jon and Olga Pender of Shirley; three daughters and two sons-in-law, Kerry M. Goodhue of Ayer, Constance E. and Gary Cooper, Mary Ann and Gary Prince, both of Shirley; a brother, Daniel Pender of Littleton; two sisters, Patricia M. Weger of Oklahoma and Agnes Ambrose of Ocean Port, N.J. He also leaves 14 grandchildren and four great-grandchildren.PENDER – On Sept. 19, Martin J. Pender, 87, of Shirley. A funeral Mass will be celebrated at 10 a.m. Monday at St. Mary’s Church, 31 Shirley St., Ayer. Burial will be in the parish cemetery. Calling hours are 3 to 5 p.m. Sunday at T.J. Anderson & Son Funeral Home, 46 Washington St., Ayer. Memorial contributions may be made to the Residents Activity Fund, Apple Valley Nursing & Rehabilitation Center, 400 Groton Road, Ayer, MA. 01432.
